Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In two minutes I want you to come into this meeting and tell me I have a really important phone call. I'm not going to take it because I want him to know how important the meeting is to me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who's calling?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nobody. Just say that I'm- Just make it up that I have a phone call. And then I'm going to refuse to take it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're not going to take it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just make up a phone call. It's not a real call. Make it up.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ohohohoh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And come and tell me. Doesn't matter what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're not going to get it though?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not going to take it. And then he's going to be like "whoa this is a really important meeting".

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Copy that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, so tell me exactly what kind of deal you are getting now and I'll tell you how we can beat it.

Quote.Speaker: Client
Quote.Text: Uh well we've been going with...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You have a very important call.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm sorry - I'm with a very important client. It'll have to wait.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Are you sure? It's really, really important.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There is nothing more important to me right now than this meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really? Because your mother is dead.

Quote.Speaker: Client
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't think she's dead.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: She's dead. She was hit by a bus.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's not dead. This is exactly the kind of thing my mom pulls.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This isn't one of those times. It's the police. They said it's the worst they've ever seen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy I'm really sorry about your mother. My deepest condolences.

Quote.Speaker: Client
Quote.Text: Oh you must take this call. It's...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Um line 1?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Line 2.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [on phone]It's Darryl. Erin told me to pretend to be a cop and say your mom died.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ooh, gosh!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dude.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Officer.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look man this is a bad idea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did she have any last words or?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Really? That is messed up man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh make sure that your client gets the best deal possible.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're a bad man Andy Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is so mom.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That stuff can come back to get you. It's called karma. You do not want to be messing around. I got an uncle...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright thank you officer. Erin please hold all my other calls. Where were we?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Cathy.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How's it going? Everything make sense?

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: I think everything is under control.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: You should sit down.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh no, I'm fine.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: No I should go fill out my paperwork.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok [squeaking sound] Oh that was just me. Pregnant Pam. And I make sounds much worse than this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh we know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm training a temp to be my replacement while I'm on maternity leave. Oh I should've mentioned I'm pregnant. You probably didn't notice because it's impossible to tell I'm so small. But yeah I'm pregnant. [another squeak] Oh come on!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey - asking for a friend. Do you happen to know if that new girl is single?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm. Doubt it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah me too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You doubt it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why do you doubt that she's single?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Honestly I have no idea. I just figured we'd save her from Ryan right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What are you doing with my lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm delivering it from the fridge. It's like a porno. Hey did anyone order a pizza?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah and we're not about to make love. I just thought maybe you'd want to eat lunch at your desk today so that during lunch we could go down to the warehouse and bang out a few tunes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I like the sound of that. Is Kevin in?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh you tell me [Kevin playing drums with chicken legs]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So word on the street is she has a boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well he's probably a drug dealer. That's the best way to land a hot girlfriend. You just uh get her hooked on blow.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's going to be nice to have just a healthy, young, fit presence in the middle of the office.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah aesthetically speaking she adds a nice presence.

Quote.Speaker: Offscreen
Quote.Text: Good energy

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's going to be good to have someone hot at Pam's desk huh?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, no. Not even.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm kidding! Oh my gosh you guys! She's obviously super cute I get it. But I'd like to point out there's 50 pounds more of me to love if that's your thing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam you look more beautiful now than ever.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Radiant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. Really you guys thank you. Very sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah you have this sexy glow.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: It's one of the most common fetishes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really well thank you all.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know it's not just pregnant women who don't get their due. You know who's gorgeous? Helen Mirren.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes! Have you seen her in a bikini? Amazing?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know what would be the hottest thing ever? It's a pregnant Helen Mirren.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [everyone agrees]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok ok ok no no no. This is disgusting. You realize what you're saying? The hottest thing ever would be a 66 year old pregnant woman.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: In this case yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! There are universal biological standards of beauty and attraction. And you are purposefully celebrating the opposite of them to mollycoddle a pregnant woman.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No we're not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes you are. And another thing. Helen Mirren was born Helen Mironov. That's right. You're fake salivating over a Soviet era Russian.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [scatting] Ske-be-do-bah-bap-bah-de, ske-be-de-bapa-de-bapa-boopa-dooten-bebe-daten-booray.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nice scatting, man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. I think I said doop instead of boop at one point.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Not bad fellas, you're better than you look.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, screw you!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sees Robert California enter] Hey Robert, are we meeting early?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Just taking a stroll. What exactly have I stumbled upon here?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well we're all musicians and we play together sometimes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You're a band.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We're called Kevin and the Zits.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That was never agreed upon.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I miss being in a band.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Miss no more! What do you play? Join us!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I have a tambourine.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Tambourine? You know I'm the CEO, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] CEOs don't play tambourines. Tambourines are for girlfriends.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I play harmonica. I think I have one in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice guys, Robert is going to be a Zit!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Again, never agreed upon.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I had totally given up on hanging out with Robert California and now he wants to be in our band! And when you're in a rock and roll band with somebody, you're bonded for life!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Usually that life is short and tragic. That's okay, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, even cooler.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We all got to go sometime.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Helen Mirren. Hot?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Super pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Huh. What about Cathy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The temp?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Do you think she's hot?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not asking if you're in to her. Just, objectively, do you find her attractive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I'm telling you, I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't find Cathy attractive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not going to tell my nine-months-pregnant wife that I find her replacement objectively attractive. Just like I'm not going to tell my two-year-old daughter that violent video games are objectively more fun. It's true, but it doesn't help anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Look at her. Even I want some fries with that shake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Uh, I don't. So are we good? [Jim leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's just absurd.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, because she's hot, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Her breasts are large, her waist is small, her reproductive health in ample evidence. And facial symmetry- come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The thing about pregnancy is people treat you differently. Like you're a kid almost. They lose all sense of boundaries. They start acting weird, telling you things that clearly aren't true. I know it sounds nuts, but I think Dwight is the only one who's telling me the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, am I hot right now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why would I or anyone else think that you're hot right now? I can't impregnate you, and that's the driving force between male-female attraction.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What about before? Was I attractive before?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Meh... you were at your most attractive when you were 24 with a slight, gradual decline and a steep drop-off when you got pregnant for the first time. Gradual recovery and, uh, well now, obviously, you're at an all-time low.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm. I think Jim's lying to me about not being attracted to Cathy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You think Jim's lying? [laughs] That's so cute. I know he's lying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Five bucks if you can get him to admit it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Done. [Pam goes for a high five] I never touch a pregnant woman.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep, that's the Dwight I need.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If we're going to work together, we need some ground rules.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Rule one: our only loyalty is to the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think so. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Rule two: we stop at nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, what does that... is that... okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Rule three: Don't fall in love.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep, good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're gonna bust this guy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Honesty is very important to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So important. And then we will destroy the man himself.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's just see how we feel when we get there.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, you came to the right person. You have to follow your intuition, Pam. You don't want to end up like Elin Nordegren. Actually, what am I saying, you wish you had her life- no offense, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: None taken. What do you got?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It is called the matchmaker test, and it is very powerful. Basically we have Pam ask Jim which of his friends he would set up with Cathy. If Jim picks a really hot friend, then we know that he thinks that Cathy's hot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [to the keyboardist, Curtis, and the drummer] Hey, you found us!

Quote.Speaker: Curtis
Quote.Text: You guys sound great, man.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Darryl, Andy, Kevin, this is Curtis Dorough, local musician and the officiate at my wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Local musician? Local legend! I used to come hear you play every week at the Deerhead.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to drummer] Dude, you're on TV! You're the sportscaster on channel seven.

Quote.Speaker: Drummer
Quote.Text: Go Eagles! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You do that on TV!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You guys mind if they join us?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, absolutely!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys, I've got some instruments right here. [holds up tambourine and güiro]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, why don't you and me play those?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah? Okay, this is awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: What should we play?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Maybe we should warm up with some scales?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Midnight Rambler?

Quote.Speaker: Curtis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Midnight what?

Quote.Speaker: Curtis
Quote.Text: [singing] Have you heard about the midnight rambler? [Lisa, the guitarist, enters] Hey, come on in, baby. Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, I was talking to Cathy. Turns out she is single.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I stand corrected.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought it might be fun to set her up with someone. Any ideas?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you know who might be good? Mike Tibbets.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mike Tibbets, really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, who's this Mike Tibbets guy? What kind of car does he drive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not his mom's car.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, 'cause his mom's car's probably not a Nissan Z.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Touche?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [sees photo of Mike Tibbets] Eww!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kelly, calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I mean, I guess he'd be okay with hair. Okay, you should see if he'll get hair plugs.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think Jim cares about his hair.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I do Pam, okay? It's called being a nice person.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't see what's so ugly about him. He's got the broad face of a brewer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim's on to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, Jim barely talks to Mike. We had to go through like two levels of friends to even find his profile. Jim picked someone just unattractive enough to shut me up without tipping it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just ugly enough to have deniability.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mike Tibbets is like the most boring-looking guy I know. So if that was for the matchmaker test, I think I'm in the clear. If that wasn't for the matchmaker test, then... Cathy, he's a really nice guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, Jim may be lying with his words, but he can't lie with his body.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm gonna write something mean on his wall.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Kelly, don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The male reveals attraction through unconscious and involuntary physical signs. The puffing of the chest, mirroring, increased blood flow to the crotch. I say we start there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam and Kelly
Quote.Text: With the crotch?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: With the crotch.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [music plays] Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Psst. We're not here. [slips Toblerone candy to Creed]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Who said that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: How'd I get this long triangle?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, just shut it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is he puffing out his chest?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't tell. It's unnaturally sunken. [Jim says something and Cathy laughs] Busted. He just was mirroring. Did you see that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. Maybe he just said something funny.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim has no discernible sense of humor, Pam. You should know that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think he's just making her laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Time for me to find out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why's he making her laugh so much?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just going to walk over here- [fake trips] whoa, whoa, I'm slipping and falling! Oh, stumbling, I need something to grab on to! [grabs Jim's crotch]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm fine, I'm totally fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight! Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes? [Jim pushes Dwight's hands away] Wha- Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Cathy] Sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aw, cramp, I'm just- [grabs Jim's crotch again]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight! [pushes Dwight's hands away] Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I fell down, Mr. Balance.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Leave.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Does your husband have very soft erections? Because if not, I just grabbed a very soft penis for nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why was he making her laugh so much?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, I'll just be a second.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Yeah, take your time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Oh, that line from Zoolander?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: It was from a deleted scene so we were both right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] Told you.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Um, do I hand in my expense reports to a particular accountant or-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, Cathy has a question!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Sorry, um, I'll just go ask Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why won't you just admit that she's attractive? It's kind of annoying that you won't say it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, what can I do to make you believe me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, Dwight had this idea, and I thought it was kind of crazy. But maybe that's where we are now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She called it crazy? Aw, man, that's insulting. All I did was propose a makeshift lie-detector test. Monitoring his blood pressure, pulse, perspiration, and breathing rate.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, its nuts. But I don't know what else to do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And she called it nuts?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Seriously, that was hot. Feel like you and the newsman had a groove going.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you know that Lisa toured with Chaka Khan?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you serious? From Star Trek?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [to Val] Hey, you caught some of that?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: I caught it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What, you don't like the blues?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: I might enjoy seeing you guys play the blues.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, we are playing. We're all playing together. These are our jam buddies. It's a jam session. We go where the music takes us. [music starts]

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: I think the music left without you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop shoving me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mocking] Stop shoving me. Stop grabbing my penis. Grow up. Take off your jacket and take a seat. When it lies, the human body exhibits many telltale signs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This could all go away if you just tell me the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Old Man
Quote.Text: Uh, are you all in line?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you go check out the sympathy cards, old man? [to Jim] Now I'm going to ask you just a few simple questions. Wait for this to constrict. Here we go. Is your name Jim Halpert?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Si.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, that's it? That's the question you're going to ask him?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have to start with a baseline question to establish what the truth is.

Quote.Speaker: Old Man
Quote.Text: You have to share the machine with others.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mimicking] Well, that's what they taught me in my 19th century kindergarten.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight, come on. [to old man] You can go first.

Quote.Speaker: Old Man
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what? This reminds me, Cece needs a new toothbrush.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Maybe we could switch instruments.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 'Cause, uh, my body's starting to get bruised.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, maybe everyone move one instrument to the right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We had to leave because of creative differences.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah they kind of had a specific sound that didn't really fit in with our thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys, this means they're Kevin and the Zits now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No man, we are.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to old man] Okay, you're done.

Quote.Speaker: Old Man
Quote.Text: I have a new heart, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you really, Tin Man? Okay, where were we?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not worried. Because this lie isn't for me, it's for Pam. And when she gets her body back and her confidence back... yes, I will tell her the truth. That I had feelings for a co-worker today that I haven't had in years. But in my defense, he was grabbing my crotch fairly aggressively at the time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you find Cathy Simms attractive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yep, he's lying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah, see, was that so hard?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am not lying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, are you really gonna listen to his stupid homemade test?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would listen to my homemade test, because your husband is definitely lying. In fact, he's lied about every question. Even his name. Who are you really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at the numbers. Every single time, it's come up 150 over 100. Your husband is a pathological liar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, you have high blood pressure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, he is definitely attracted to her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Doesn't your dad have high blood pressure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I don't smoke.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When was the last time you went to the doctor?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's important to go every month and get your prostate checked. You can do it at home by yourself with your finger. You just stick it-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, stop. I'm not kidding, I mean, I need you to take care of yourself. What would we do if something happened to you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, easy. Trust me, I'm around for the long-haul.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not really your choice, is it? Death waits for no man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on, let's go. I wanna call your doctor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Doesn't it worry you in the slightest that Jim is not his real name?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just go home. It doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But... hey, Cece's toothbrush.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh baby I love your way.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Every day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Darryl
Quote.Text: Wanna be with you night and day.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl and Kevin
Quote.Text: And day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh baby I love your way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [scatting] Rudit-do-do-do-di-do.
